channel.title: Tutorials
channel.description: Learn or teach how to skin/model.

item.title: [UT200x-Skinning]: Making skins of good quality with low effort
item.author: invalid@example.com (Maxx)
item.dc:creator: Maxx
item.content:encoded:
This tutorial shows some easy tricks to let your skin become looking more professional. It is ment for beginners and so there are only some basic clues to be found here, but if you practise and try out more you`re skins can become pretty nice with less effort. Personally I used Paintshop Pro 10 for skinning, so the usage might differ in other programmes.

First of all I want to tell you how many people rate skin quality:

Bad: Simply added some colors in upaint, no shading effects, no...

[UT200x-Skinning]: Making skins of good quality with low effort

item.title: [Modelling] : Creating Ragdolls with KAT
item.author: invalid@example.com (EvilEngine)
item.dc:creator: EvilEngine
item.content:encoded:
Yeh I know it's kinda late to have one of these, but after alot of people asking me how to make ragdolls(especially ones for small or larger models) I put this together for a small online class I am giving some TeamOrbit team members. For UT2007 I will try to make one for UnrealPHat too, but for now heres how to make ragdolls:
http://www.3dartmarket.com/EvilEngine/HTML/Ragdoll_Creation.htm
It's rough and will change over time with better html. But I think its ok for a quick...

[Modelling] : Creating Ragdolls with KAT

item.title: Looking for female skeleton for UT04
item.author: invalid@example.com (Antigen)
item.dc:creator: Antigen
item.content:encoded: I need the female skeleton for Unreal 04 for a character I'm doing. If any one knows a download link where I could find it at or has instructions on how to extract it from the game, that would be great.

item.title: UT3 Skeletons for Maya
item.author: invalid@example.com (Vailias)
item.dc:creator: Vailias
item.content:encoded:
Update: Now including First Person Arms
http://www.fileplanet.com/193547/190000/fileinfo/UT3-Skeletons-FBX-format,-Maya-compatible

Thought this might be of some use to a few guys around here.
oXYnard exported the max skels to fbx, but they didn't export right out of maya, some bones came over as mesh data, so I fixed that and repackaged the things. All is well now out of maya.
Enjoy, and happy modding!

item.title: UT2003/4 Wireframes
item.author: invalid@example.com (SaD)
item.dc:creator: SaD
item.content:encoded:
Kirin submitted a UT2004 Wireframe set.

Here is a snip from the read-me :

In this package contains the wireframe textures for both UT2003 and UT2004 player models (excluding the Necris, Metal Guard, and MechaSkaarj from the BonusPacks).

Note that I haven't ripped wires from every single player model. Aside from the BonusPack models, A few models are nearly identical with each other:

AbaddonM = BonusNightmare
EnigmaM = XanF01
MercFemale1 = MercFemale_Glynn
MercFemale2 =...

UT2003/4 Wireframes

item.title: [General]-Skinning: Texture source
item.author: invalid@example.com (daloonie)
item.dc:creator: daloonie
item.content:encoded:
For anyone who wishes to use my textures or post their textures, this thread is the place. The purpose of this thread is mainly for skinners/modelers to share whatever textures they have/use for all to benefit from.

Of course you may as well use these textures as you like as long as you show some proper respect and don't post unaltered versions as your own elsewhere.

My textures: http://rapidshare.de/files/9634266/DaLoonie_Textures.zip.html

item.title: [UT 200X] Working With Stock Species
item.author: invalid@example.com (Starry Might)
item.dc:creator: Starry Might
item.content:encoded:
Good evening, class!

In tonight's lesson, we are going to learn how to work with Species...namely the ones that come with "UT 2003/2004". (There will be no discussion of custom Species, since that's far beyond my abilities and the scope of this tutorial.)

The Species of a character affects a few different things:

(1) It's part of what determines which voice any given character has by default, (gender is the other half of this equation, and also effects which stock voicepacks a...

[UT 200X] Working With Stock Species

item.title: [UT 2004] Character Bios in Separate .INT Files
item.author: invalid@example.com (Starry Might)
item.dc:creator: Starry Might
item.content:encoded:
Good evening, class!

In tonight's lesson, I'm gonna teach you how to make and use .int files to store Bios for your custom characters.

I'm not sure which version of "UT 2004" made it possible to have character Bios in separate .int files (here's MäxX's theory). But it's definitely possible now, and is, IMHO, the best way to do character Bios now.

So, okay! Let's see how it's done!

Let's say you have a...

[UT 2004] Character Bios in Separate .INT Files

item.title: [UT200X]-Skinning : Making a good Spec Shader
item.author: invalid@example.com (daloonie)
item.dc:creator: daloonie
item.content:encoded:
Tutorial for creating a good Specular Shader

This tutorial will briefly cover how to make a simple and quick Specular Shader with a Shader and a Final Blend.
I will base this tutorial around my recent creation, not yet finished(8/11-2005), Mariah.
I will use the head of my skin in this tutorial. I will also have masked some things out on this head. Look in the Masking tutorial if you don't know how to do that.
I resized the textures to keep thread loading time down. You...

[UT200X]-Skinning : Making a good Spec Shader

item.title: [UT200X]-Skinning : LOD Settings For UT200X
item.author: invalid@example.com (klasnic)
item.dc:creator: klasnic
item.content:encoded:
For LOD Settings info for UT, click here

A brief explanation of LOD, what it is and why it's important;

LOD is the Level Of Detail UT200X uses on a texture in a map, on a weapon texture or whatever. If you want your skin to display the way it's meant to be displayed going by Texture Detail/Character Detail in UT200X-Settings, then you need to change a few things in your skin's texture package to do this.

By...

[UT200X]-Skinning : LOD Settings For UT200X

item.title: How to get skins and or models to work with unreal
item.author: invalid@example.com (Vailias)
item.dc:creator: Vailias
item.content:encoded:
Apparently this info is not in any easy to find place so here it is, so none of us ever has to type it out longhand again.

Unreal skins and model packs come in 2 flavors, UMOD and Zip.

Umod you simply double click and the files get put where they go.

Zip is more common and takes a little tinsy bit of effor to get working.

Zip instructions: UT2kX

Models will likely have 3 files in the archive, skins only 2.

one ends in .UKX this is the actual mesh and animations for the...

How to get skins and or models to work with unreal

item.title: [UT200X]-Skinning : Inserting own Team-Logos
item.author: invalid@example.com (Maxx)
item.dc:creator: Maxx
item.content:encoded:
Hi!

Neither I know if anybody has done such a tut before (but I didn`t find one), nor I know if anybody needs that)

Anyway, if you are interested in adding your personal (clan)logo to the game, maybe you`ll read further on. First of all, I apologize for upcoming fatal syntax errors and bad grammatics

WARNING: This tut does not explain every step, so you should be a little bit familiar with UEdit and a good Graphic Tool (eg.: Paint Shop Pro or Photoshop)...

[UT200X]-Skinning : Inserting own Team-Logos

item.title: [UT200X]-Skinning : Masking
item.author: invalid@example.com (daloonie)
item.dc:creator: daloonie
item.content:encoded:
Tutorial for masking out parts of a player model.

For this tutorial I assume you have a basic knowledge of the UnrealED 3.0 interface. And is farely known to the interface in Adobe Photoshop 7.

I'll take this in steps.
1. What is masking?
2. Get an idea of what you want to be done.
3. Can it be done?
4. Making an Alpha channel.
5. Exporting/Importing the texture.
6. Final product.




1. What is masking?...

[UT200X]-Skinning : Masking

item.title: [General]-Skinning : Texture Overlay - Mini-tutorial
item.author: invalid@example.com (old_man_funk)
item.dc:creator: old_man_funk
item.content:encoded:
Giving your textures more depth and realism:

Using a texture overlay you can give your skin that little bit of extra polish. Do your skins end up looking to cartoony or false? If so then this will help you!



  • Your finished texture
  • Get an ovrlay texture from any good image site (or make your own)
  • Paste the overlay above your texture and then set the blend mode to 'Overlay'...

[General]-Skinning : Texture Overlay - Mini-tutorial

item.title: A new section is born
item.author: invalid@example.com (SaD)
item.dc:creator: SaD
item.content:encoded:
We started a new subforum.

We will add many tutorials the next time . I hope many of the experienced board-user will follow with some good tutorials.Be it general-skinning or UT2004-specific .Everything goes.

I´d like to thank Lawgiver and the entire Identity Crisis - Staff for the permission to host their Tutorials here.

I started with the first 3 tutorials.I have many more to post.

item.title: [Technical] : Specular Skin Shaders
item.author: invalid@example.com (SaD)
item.dc:creator: SaD
item.content:encoded:
Specular Skin Shader

Created by: ChiQ

Tutorial copied with the friendly permission from Identity Crisis .

To create a shader or an environmental map for UT2003 you will need UnrealEd, which comes with the game, as well as a program that can export to DDS (Direct Draw Surface) or 32 Bit TGA. I used Photoshop 5. You may also find that the...
